topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536ec80663687219709a0200#post_536ec80663687219709a0200
[bq="SquiggyBomb"]So has anyone else watched RWBY?[/bq]
Eeyup.

I'm actually excited to see where this kind of thing goes really.  The traditional sense is that you have to either have cgi, traditional animation or flash animation.  Flash animation can't do everything and sometimes looks wonky.  A lot of times cgi is used poorly.  Traditional animation is expensive.  I like to call RWBY pseudo anime in that they try to make it like a anime with cgi; which hasn't really been done before all that much.

topics.body:
Well my father called me and talked about jury selection, and it occurred to me why the Nigerian Prince scheme is still used.

It's so well publicized that anyone who takes it remotely seriously is already gullible and is automatically a good mark. It's a way of selecting for really gullible people who will give more money.

Pretty much just Game Theory.

This can't be verified naturally but it's similar to how lawyers will try to piss people off to get jurors biased against their side to recuse themselves.
